alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Livingston and northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 400 PM CDT... At 329 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Watson, or near Denham Springs, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Walker, Watson and Greenwell Spring. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 9 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
